p: Psidium salutare oil, rich in p-cymene (5.1–17.8%), terpinolene (6.9–17.0%), γ-terpinene (10.3–17.1%), epi-α-cadinol (10.4–12.8%), linalool (4.7–7.3%), and δ-cadinene (3.8–5.3%) exhibited significant activity against Candida albicans (MFC 1.0–4.1 µg/mL), Candida krusei, (MFC 8.2–16.4 µg/mL), and Candida tropicalis (MFC > 16.4 mg/mL) [ 25].
